block.p: Vicki Arroyo and John Carey were married yesterday at the Unitarian Universalist Church of Arlington in Virginia. The Rev. Richard Nugent performed the ceremony.

Ms. Arroyo, 42, is keeping her name. She is the director of policy analysis at the Pew Center on Global Climate Change, a nonprofit research group in Arlington. She is also an actress who has appeared in community theater. She graduated magna cum laude from Emory University and received a master's degree in public administration from Harvard. She also received a law degree magna cum laude from Georgetown University, where she was the editor in chief of The Georgetown International Environmental Law Review.

Ms. Arroyo, 42, is keeping her name. She is the director of policy analysis at the Pew Center on Global Climate Change, a nonprofit research group in Arlington. She is also an actress who has appeared in community theater. She graduated magna cum laude from Emory University and received a master's degree in public administration from Harvard. She also received a law degree magna cum laude from Georgetown University, where she was the editor in chief of The Georgetown International Environmental Law Review.

She is a daughter of Verna L. Arroyo of Arlington and the late Sidney Arroyo. Her father was a controller at E. H. Gilmore Inc., an engineering firm in Jefferson, La. He was also an actor in New Orleans. Her mother was a children's entertainer.

Mr. Carey, 51, is a senior correspondent in the Washington bureau of Business Week magazine. A magna cum laude graduate of Yale, he received a master's degree in marine biology from the University College of North Wales and a Master of Forest Science degree, also from Yale.
He is a son of Philip Carey of Princeton, N.J., and the late Priscilla Carey. His father is retired as a personal assistant to the president of Gale Research, a publishing company in Detroit.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce; the bridegroom was a widower.
